document.title: Indiana Academic Standards English/Language Arts: Grades K-5

9683A20AF51F4FAABED21ED71DCC06EC.description: Recognize common signs and logos and identify commercials or advertisements.

1CD8F3629BC7498D8691F956EAA1378F.description: Recognize the purposes of media and the ways in which media can have influences

462D3C485DC544608C46509FB2A2FBB4.description: Develop an understanding of media and the roles and purposes of media

comments: Students develop critical thinking about the messages received and created by media. Students recognize that media are a part of culture and function as agents of socialization and information, and they develop understanding that people use individual skills, beliefs, and experiences to construct their own meanings from media messages. Students develop media literacy skills in order to become more informed, reflective, and engaged participants in society.

7ECBED24CA394C668F655B0C100EB839.description: Give, restate, and follow simple two-step directions.

F34D8EF90E694386BBD1B912E40CE0A2.description: Speaking audibly, recite poems, rhymes, and songs, and use complete sentences to describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with support, provide additional details.

D93B8D2DC67B4A24BB8F23747AE7ACA9.description: Develop and apply speaking skills to communicate ideas effectively in a variety of situations

D419A71C775448D2B2858F97B0154F13.description: Ask appropriate questions about what a speaker says.

1E2FC35DBB384E5AA1E02EFF94FC38DD.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

3085DD30ABFB4DD3A7C422FB1C6C2D7D.description: Develop and apply active listening and interpretation skills using various strategies

344646FC4E6849019166CD3D3B766FB0.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

4815D4EA623846ABAF82E0F52454031B.description: Ask questions to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

8C1B5C61977E43618350BF19809DA517.description: Listen to others, take turns speaking, and add one's own ideas to small group discussions or tasks.

04636138577F4E56878819A19BB19C08.description: Participate in collaborative conversations about grade-appropriate topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

FD69EE6ADFB2429AA894686F62E83727.description: Develop and apply reciprocal communication skills by participating in a range of collaborative discussions

CEBCC282018C4DADA148CD705D994CB9.description: Listen actively and communicate effectively with a variety of audiences and for different purposes.

94AB30E6D1BB488EAFA070054371E538.description: Develop and apply effective communication skills through speaking and active listening

comments: There are five key areas found in the Speaking and Listening section for grades K-5: Discussion and Collaboration, Comprehension, and Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas. By demonstrating the skills listed in each section, students should be able to meet the Learning Outcome for Speaking and Listening.

4BA71963C9A24C14AC9ACB5166F20402.description: Spelling – Spelling simple words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness.

B11F9FFB2AE64AC6B44697AB785E83B7.description: Punctuation – Recognizing and naming end punctuation.

9F110377C3CC4C2AABA7595E1615FCDA.description: Capitalization – Capitalizing the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

5AD422D4831A43DE9DC468857B4E3657.description: Demonstrate command of capitalization, punctuation, and spelling, focusing on:

FADEF5A263BF48D495F5ACC580405166.description: Usage – Recognizing that there are different kinds of sentences (e.g., sentences that tell something, sentences that ask something, etc.).

034D7DAE43CA438B869C4BB8F9EDA5A5.description: Prepositions – Standard begins at fourth grade.

1537F251C66F4606A609FFC1E8246123.description: Adjectives/Adverbs – Standard begins at second grade.

14F5116B82AF46EFA5CB6928A2DCCFA0.description: Nouns/Pronouns – Writing sentences that include singular and/or plural nouns (e.g., dog/dogs, cat/cats).

1A65CAB96943424A822771CB8AD27959.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage, focusing on:

7B7B71CF6A2E4F59AAF36E4F62C877A5.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English

25CF77F20642460F9E21B959895F4753.description:
With support, build understanding of a topic using various sources.
  • Identify relevant pictures, charts, grade-appropriate texts, personal experiences, or people as sources of information on a topic.

B74188B6E9F24DE29F06DDC96FDB11B1.description: Finding, Assessing, Synthesizing, and Reporting Information

811A320245334BDD853BAF779A8FCFA8.description: Build knowledge about the research process and the topic under study by conducting short research

7B091E975DF349FF9310EB50987483D6.description:
Apply the writing process to –
  • With support, revise writing by adding simple details; review (edit) writing for format and conventions (e.g., correct spelling of simple words, capitalization of the first word of the sentence).
  • Use available technology to produce and publish writing.

6E5060AEFA8E491F8292E5802790FF83.description: Produce coherent and legible documents by planning, drafting, revising, editing, and collaborating with others

7971579F24C243E18A35E7AB772FE80C.description: Use words and pictures to narrate a single event or simple story, arranging ideas in order.

DB5D3D3CE4BB4CF28314E7B1DA474339.description: Use words and pictures to develop a main idea and provide some information about a topic.

07EA028ADBDA47BD8E631D5B92954FD6.description: Use words and pictures to provide logical reasons for suggesting that others follow a particular course of action.

E16343CDB2E54E7A902E2B2DD9B36672.description: Develop writing skills by writing for different purposes and to specific audiences or people

C67F294447DC4C08B41851FC8C79EA8D.description: Write by moving from left to right and top to bottom.

150FA77C90ED40428BF8C6C2ED284158.description: Write most uppercase (capital) and lowercase letters of the alphabet, correctly shaping and spacing the letters of the words.

AF07DF0C735545C39895A32451F1B621.description: Demonstrate the ability to write legibly

27550A347F5F4C989B4C5FFA2138A1F4.description: Write for specific purposes and audiences.

C5DF61E6415B4A1699EF55579660E969.description: Write effectively for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences

comments: There are five key areas found in the Writing section for grades K-5: Handwriting, Writing Genres, the Writing Process, the Research Process, and Conventions of Standard English. By demonstrating the skills listed in each section, students should be able to meet the Learning Outcome for Writing.

423C3BCA875847678DB381601AA41714.description: With support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a nonfiction text.

B93157E8A9F544DFACCCF9491C7F6382.description: With support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in stories, poems, or songs.

9751316B0CEC480AADD0DD2F9419523B.description: Vocabulary in Literature and Nonfiction Texts

FE987E4EEB404ADF893AD383A36C2F9B.description: Build appreciation and understanding of literature and nonfiction texts by determining or clarifying the meanings of words and their uses

3A528CD0033345D6B02B4FEE66B37881.description: Recognize frequently occurring inflections (e.g., look, looks).

E12105C3A4A944BE9D7D8670503E4F3E.description: Identify and sort pictures of objects into categories (e.g., colors, shapes, opposites).

6647AE64069C4DD3A3B2C657301184EA.description: Use strategies to determine and clarify words and understand their relationships

56BB87D3E0CF4082A9F4B16A83290F8C.description: Use words, phrases, and strategies acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to literature and nonfiction texts to build and apply vocabulary.

302108A820C44157AEFC4FEDB595A8EE.description: Build and apply vocabulary using various strategies and sources

comments: There are two key areas found in the Reading: Vocabulary section for grades K-5: Vocabulary Building and Vocabulary and Literary and Nonfiction Texts. By demonstrating the skills listed in each section, students should be able to meet the Learning Outcome for Reading: Vocabulary.

0510016E18984E7DA9856CB0962F9572.description: With support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic.

87E4AED4093843DEBAAB27FF82C8F7C9.description: With support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

A0D708DFFD8B4EC2B19D0D9FE97F097D.description: Build understanding of nonfiction texts by verifying points and making connections between topics and ideas

9C4004DFB7C24064A72FAD1CD585112D.description: Recognize that a nonfiction text can be structured to describe a topic.

40A35FBCB74244D882268B9BC8E9E621.description: Identify text features of a nonfiction text (e.g., title, author, illustrations) and describe the relationship between those features and the text in which they appear.

C66AC7ACA5364EE38F6AC97B4E8A88D3.description: Build understanding of nonfiction text, using knowledge of text features, structures, and author's perspective

21C6FD65188D40A5A0DD28DAB6498D3E.description: With support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

C9CD2BF8A9154D93A667817A66D8C45F.description: With support, retell the main idea and key details of a text.

D17B9AFE377F45628F461A715E56F882.description: With support, ask and answer questions about important elements of a text (e.g., events, topics, concepts).

164D4B0CAFB745E79DC460F9F446CEC4.description: Extract and construct meaning from nonfiction texts using a range of comprehension skills

057B0399C2C24F8788629815BA6DCAAE.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

E8D6F7258458425CA629B999125DC95A.description: Read and comprehend a variety of nonfiction independently and proficiently

comments: There are three key areas found in the Reading: Nonfiction section for grades K-5: Key Ideas and Textual Support, Features and Structure, and Connection of Ideas. By demonstrating the skills listed in each section, students should be able to meet the Learning Outcome for Reading: Nonfiction.

931EC5DF32FC41E6B45933BF9B6290F7.description: With support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

3E34E9FDB4794EAF8715F72B2A188102.description: With support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear.

D09ACA995E7F4FC1A88195B13FD23D81.description: Build comprehension and appreciation of literature by connecting literary elements and themes and analyzing how sensory tools impact meaning

F20B9AE5D8E4463DA163DE6EFED19F4B.description: With support, define the role of the author and illustrator of a story in telling the story.

3FA31A771195408A84879FD8E3D101E0.description: Recognize familiar narrative text genres (e.g., fairy tales, nursery rhymes, storybooks).

3A13D8330310495283731E0FD0F61DA1.description: Build comprehension and appreciation of literature, using knowledge of literary structure and point of view

E0296F3A6E2941A289A8152F0731F259.description: Make predictions about what will happen in a story.

A15F53345AA043E99E9A8826FCEC30AD.description: Identify important elements of the text (e.g., characters, settings, or events).

4BE39B99EFB84222B14A711BB76FC0BF.description: With support, retell familiar stories, poems, and nursery rhymes, including key details.

098EA859474C4AD29691D04435DDF3ED.description: With support, ask and answer questions about main topics and key details in a text heard or read.

99B8141F58EC46E4A876D950B651EBEE.description: Build comprehension and appreciation of literature by identifying, describing, and making inferences about literary elements and themes

E551EF6EE07B46BBBA228B50D3E60527.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

C46CE95EA20543F0AFCFD6782D3D564A.description: Read and comprehend a variety of literature independently and proficiently

comments: There are three key areas found in the Reading: Literature section for grades K-5: Key Ideas and Textual Support, Structural Elements and Organization, and Connection of Ideas. By demonstrating the skills listed in each section, students should be able to meet the Learning Outcome for Reading: Literature.

3D57134434A646BCA5A775D6722B1F60.description: Read emergent-reader texts, maintaining an appropriate pace and using self-correcting strategies while reading.

9414F17EC9FE464CBF67735A2A889F7E.description: Demonstrate accuracy and fluency when reading

75ECDF5E51EC44BC8CD7ED0061D4AD73.description: Identify similarities and differences in words (e.g., word endings, onset and rime) when spoken or written.

833E6D1B96574254B8C58CD8BC58E377.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., a, my).

FFEC72F0D92A48C39D833AA7B53975C8.description: Recognize the long and short sounds for the five major vowels.

B291D20EC2E9453C975972EC4C9CFBCE.description: Blend consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) sounds to make words.

C2EEE649D3E74CE6BA2E31689933DAC7.description: Use letter-sound knowledge to decode the sound of each consonant (e.g., dog = /d/ /g/; soap = /s/ /p/).

6A01DE5295A14C439E86E30074F0C793.description: Decode and read words by applying phonics and word analysis skills

54384204656845209DB116080B3459F4.description: Add, delete, or substitute sounds to change words.

E3A36FB02768458389D8755CBC711408.description: Tell the order of sounds heard in words with two or three phonemes, and identify the beginning, middle (medial) and final sounds.

76BF6F0A145D44F3A18D43C455014A2F.description: Orally blend the onset (the initial sound) and the rime (the vowel and ending sound) in words.

DC445DE2B6FE4031A361B5CC4CB1F28E.description: Orally pronounce, blend, and segment words into syllables.

D386EDCDE69846A5BDD3B7C007D585BC.description: Demonstrate understanding and apply knowledge of spoken words, syllables, and sounds

AFFF732292D74D18ACC9E3D821CF5DC4.description: Identify and name all uppercase (capital) and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

C92B3E4F47C44FAF8432707CC3AF4F3F.description: Recognize that words are combined to form sentences.

CDE766AD5E2B467DB6B4CFBC0F1E8D5A.description: Recognize that written words are made up of sequences of letters.

F730A3DF83A748F99F9FF9200871C205.description: Demonstrate understanding that print moves from left to right across the page and from top to bottom.

C0CE449509C84E66B481BF9798F1E150.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print, including that printed materials provide information and tell stories

6311BCAD09EA4E4E9C6505D33FCD6994.description: Understand and apply knowledge of print concepts, phonics, phonemic awareness, vocabulary, and fluency and comprehension as a foundation for developing reading skills.

A10DC4FE535948A09833A3E6DE4B8A5A.description: Develop, build, and apply knowledge of foundational reading skills

comments: There are four key areas found in the Reading: Foundations section for grades K-5: Print Concepts, Phonological Awareness, Phonics, and Fluency. By demonstrating the skills listed in each section, students should be able to meet the Learning Outcome for Reading: Foundations.
